rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about problem solving. 

Every family faces challenges, but when we work together we can deal with problems in an effective and peaceful way.

What a great skill for your teen to learn too!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about problem solving. 

Every family faces challenges, but when we work together we can deal with problems in an effective and peaceful way.

What a great skill for your teen to learn too!

media_title.eng: How can problem solving help you and your family?

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is problem solving.

We all know that in life there are times where we face problems, and we all know in a way that when we find ourselves in these situations, it is difficult to think of immediate positive solutions.

Therefore, it is important that when we are facing problems we take a pause, we breathe, keep calm and think of problem-solving skills that we may use.

Remember to include our teenagers when we are solving problems. This will help them to become responsible and learn how to solve their own problems in the future.

rows.media_title: How can problem solving help you and your family?
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is problem solving.

We all know that in life there are times where we face problems, and we all know in a way that when we find ourselves in these situations, it is difficult to think of immediate positive solutions.

Therefore, it is important that when we are facing problems we take a pause, we breathe, keep calm and think of problem-solving skills that we may use.

Remember to include our teenagers when we are solving problems. This will help them to become responsible and learn how to solve their own problems in the future.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
As parents, we sometimes think we need to fix every problem by ourselves. And teens can think the same! 

By involving your teen, you strengthen your relationship as well as their confidence. Together you can overcome anything.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
As parents, we sometimes think we need to fix every problem by ourselves. And teens can think the same! 

By involving your teen, you strengthen your relationship as well as their confidence. Together you can overcome anything.

media_title.eng: Can problem solving keep your teens safe? It did for @data.characters.media_female_4.name - tap play to hear her story

media_transcript.eng:
I did not have a good relationship with my daughter. I was always shouting at her, and she was refusing to go to school.

Only when I started spending One-on-One time with her did I realise she was being bullied at school. We sat down and used the steps of problem solving. We identified the problem and figured out solutions together: ‚ÄúWhat can I do as a parent so you can feel safe and attend school?‚Äù

We agreed I would talk to her teacher to find a way forward. We found the solutions together, and now we are much closer.

rows.media_title: Can problem solving keep your teens safe? It did for @data.characters.media_female_4.name - tap play to hear her story
rows.media_transcript:
I did not have a good relationship with my daughter. I was always shouting at her, and she was refusing to go to school.

Only when I started spending One-on-One time with her did I realise she was being bullied at school. We sat down and used the steps of problem solving. We identified the problem and figured out solutions together: ‚ÄúWhat can I do as a parent so you can feel safe and attend school?‚Äù

We agreed I would talk to her teacher to find a way forward. We found the solutions together, and now we are much closer.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Problem-solving together is an important skill for every family. Let‚Äôs see how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_son_15.name handle a problem calmly and find a plan together.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Problem-solving together is an important skill for every family. Let‚Äôs see how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_son_15.name handle a problem calmly and find a plan together.

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name comes back from the market and finds @data.characters.f2_son_15.name at home in a dirty school uniform with a sleeve missing.

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f2_son_15.name! That uniform is brand new, why did you get it all dirty and torn!

character_2_text.eng: Sorry, @data.characters.f2_grandmother_role.name. There is this guy at school, he...

rows.text_2: @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name comes back from the market and finds @data.characters.f2_son_15.name at home in a dirty school uniform with a sleeve missing.
rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f2_son_15.name! That uniform is brand new, why did you get it all dirty and torn!
rows.character_2_text: Sorry, @data.characters.f2_grandmother_role.name. There is this guy at school, he...

rows.character_1_text: Just give me a moment. I am tired and now worried about having to repair this uniform.

character_1_text.eng: Just give me a moment. I am tired and now worried about having to repair this uniform.

character_2_text.eng: This boy in class pulled me off my desk and tore my sleeve. He is kicking me every day, and takes my pens and exercise books.

character_3_text.eng:
I am sorry to hear that, but I am glad you told me, @data.characters.f2_son_15.name. We need to do something about your uniform though. After we speak, you can wash it and I will repair it. 

But first, what do you think we should do about the bully problem?

rows.character_2_text: This boy in class pulled me off my desk and tore my sleeve. He is kicking me every day, and takes my pens and exercise books.
rows.character_3_text:
I am sorry to hear that, but I am glad you told me, @data.characters.f2_son_15.name. We need to do something about your uniform though. After we speak, you can wash it and I will repair it. 

But first, what do you think we should do about the bully problem?

rows.character_1_text: He makes me so angry, I just want to hit him. Or maybe I should tell my teacher?

character_1_text.eng: He makes me so angry, I just want to hit him. Or maybe I should tell my teacher?

character_2_text.eng: Hmm‚Ä¶ what do you think would happen if you hit him? And what might happen if you tell the teacher?

character_3_text.eng: If I hit him, we might fight and I could get into trouble. If I tell the teacher, maybe the other kids will laugh at me‚Ä¶ Maybe you could talk to the teacher?

rows.character_2_text: Hmm‚Ä¶ what do you think would happen if you hit him? And what might happen if you tell the teacher?
rows.character_3_text: If I hit him, we might fight and I could get into trouble. If I tell the teacher, maybe the other kids will laugh at me‚Ä¶ Maybe you could talk to the teacher?

rows.character_1_text: That sounds like a good idea. I can speak with your teacher or the school ‚Äî they know how to handle this safely.

character_1_text.eng: That sounds like a good idea. I can speak with your teacher or the school ‚Äî they know how to handle this safely.

character_2_text.eng: Maybe wait, @data.characters.f2_grandmother_role.name‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm scared the bully will get even angrier. Maybe I can skip school tomorrow instead?

rows.character_2_text: Maybe wait, @data.characters.f2_grandmother_role.name‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm scared the bully will get even angrier. Maybe I can skip school tomorrow instead?

rows.character_1_text: No, @data.characters.f2_son_15.name, skipping school won‚Äôt help. You have a right to be safe. Let‚Äôs practise what you can say if he threatens you again ‚Äî something simple and firm.

character_1_text.eng: No, @data.characters.f2_son_15.name, skipping school won‚Äôt help. You have a right to be safe. Let‚Äôs practise what you can say if he threatens you again ‚Äî something simple and firm.

character_2_text.eng: Maybe I can say, "Stop. I don‚Äôt like that."

character_3_text.eng: Good. And remember ‚Äî walk away and stand near other children or the teacher. You are not alone.

rows.character_2_text: Maybe I can say, "Stop. I don‚Äôt like that."
rows.character_3_text: Good. And remember ‚Äî walk away and stand near other children or the teacher. You are not alone.

character_1_text.eng: How are things going at school now?

character_2_text.eng: It‚Äôs better. The boy stopped kicking me, but he still says mean things.

rows.character_1_text: How are things going at school now?
rows.character_2_text: It‚Äôs better. The boy stopped kicking me, but he still says mean things.

rows.character_1_text: I‚Äôm sorry he is still unkind. Let‚Äôs make a plan to help you stay safe. You can sit near your friends, stay close to the teacher during breaks, and walk home with someone you trust. I‚Äôll also ask my friend who works at the school to quietly look out for you. We will keep checking what works.

character_1_text.eng: I‚Äôm sorry he is still unkind. Let‚Äôs make a plan to help you stay safe. You can sit near your friends, stay close to the teacher during breaks, and walk home with someone you trust. I‚Äôll also ask my friend who works at the school to quietly look out for you. We will keep checking what works.

character_2_text.eng: Yes, thank you, @data.characters.f2_grandmother_role.name. At least I know you are on my side.

rows.character_2_text: Yes, thank you, @data.characters.f2_grandmother_role.name. At least I know you are on my side.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
When you face a problem, take a few deep breaths to help you stay calm. 
Then, try to handle the problem using these four steps!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
When you face a problem, take a few deep breaths to help you stay calm. 
Then, try to handle the problem using these four steps!

section_2_text.eng: Think of possible solutions and what would happen if we used them.

section_3_text.eng: Choose a solution and try it out.

section_4_text.eng: Did it work? Great! If it did not work, then try another solution.

rows.section_2_text: Think of possible solutions and what would happen if we used them.
rows.section_3_text: Choose a solution and try it out.
rows.section_4_text: Did it work? Great! If it did not work, then try another solution.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
You may have noticed how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_son_15.name paused, understood the problem, and explored solutions together.

These simple steps help families stay calm and find a way forward.

text_2.eng: Now let‚Äôs try problem-solving together: Imagine that @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name got a phone as a gift from a boy, and @data.characters.f1_mother.name feels worried about it.

quiz_1_question.eng:
What could @data.characters.f1_mother.name do to handle the situation when @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name got a phone from a boy? 
Tap on each option to see if these solutions worked!

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: Return the phone and save up together to buy a new one

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: Listen to @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name's side of the story

quiz_1_option_5_text.eng: Take a deep breath before reacting

character_1_text.eng: You cannot go out for the next month

character_2_text.eng: Uuugh‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs so unfair, I did not do anything wrong!

character_1_text.eng: I am not trying to accuse your friend or be jealous. I am worried that when someone gives a gift it is hard to say 'no' when they ask something in return ‚Äì like sex.

character_3_text.eng: Thank you‚Ä¶ I didn‚Äôt realise gifts could make things complicated.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
When something bad happens, we often get upset and blame. But what our teens really need is someone to help find solutions together. 

Listen to them, accept how they see and feel things, and thank them for trusting you.

Teaching your teen how to deal with problems will help them for the rest of their lives. What a gift!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
When something bad happens, we often get upset and blame. But what our teens really need is someone to help find solutions together. 

Listen to them, accept how they see and feel things, and thank them for trusting you.

Teaching your teen how to deal with problems will help them for the rest of their lives. What a gift!

text_2.eng:
**Here are some examples of problems other parents solved with their teens:**

- My teenager does not want to go to school
- I am worried my teenager will get pregnant or will get someone pregnant
- I am worried about what my teen does online
- My teenager is hanging out with bad friends
- My teenager is lazy
- My teenager is not doing their school work
- My teenager might be using drugs

rows.text_2:
**Here are some examples of problems other parents solved with their teens:**

- My teenager does not want to go to school
- I am worried my teenager will get pregnant or will get someone pregnant
- I am worried about what my teen does online
- My teenager is hanging out with bad friends
- My teenager is lazy
- My teenager is not doing their school work
- My teenager might be using drugs

rows.text_1_facilitator: Your home activity this week is to teach your teenagers the steps for problem-solving and use them together when a problem comes up.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Your home activity this week is to teach your teenagers the steps for problem-solving and use them together when a problem comes up.

text_2.eng:
**Remember to use the four steps of problem-solving:** 
üí≠ Step 1: KNOW IT (identify problem)
üìã Step 2: SOLVE IT (identify solutions) 
‚öíÔ∏è Step 3: TRY IT (try one) 
üéØ Step 4: TEST IT (try another solution if this one did not work)

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you solve one problem together with your teen this week - using the four steps?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Working together with your teen will bring so many good outcomes for you both.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: You can do it! Try it out with a ‚Äòsmall‚Äô problem that may come up, so you can see how it works before tackling a bigger challenge.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. Just remember that when a situation feels overwhelming, it can really help to use the four steps of problem solving with your teen to break the problem down.

rows.text_2:
**Remember to use the four steps of problem-solving:** 
üí≠ Step 1: KNOW IT (identify problem)
üìã Step 2: SOLVE IT (identify solutions)

üéØ Step 4: TEST IT (try another solution if this one did not work)
rows.quiz_1_question: Can you solve one problem together with your teen this week - using the four steps?
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That's great! Working together with your teen will bring so many good outcomes for you both.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: You can do it! Try it out with a ‚Äòsmall‚Äô problem that may come up, so you can see how it works before tackling a bigger challenge.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: That's okay. Just remember that when a situation feels overwhelming, it can really help to use the four steps of problem solving with your teen to break the problem down.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
We all have problems, but they don‚Äôt define us! You can choose to address challenges and try different solutions together with your teen. 
This shows your teen that they are never alone and gives them a key skill to use at home, with friends, and for life!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
We all have problems, but they don‚Äôt define us! You can choose to address challenges and try different solutions together with your teen. 
This shows your teen that they are never alone and gives them a key skill to use at home, with friends, and for life!

media_title.eng: Can you make an impact on your community with these skills? Hear @data.characters.media_son_2.name's story

media_transcript.eng:
When my father introduced the problem-solving steps to me, it helped me with my family, but it also helped me with my friends.

I told my friends about the steps, and now when we are arguing we sit down and everyone comes up with solutions. We then look for the negatives and positives of each solution, and we agree ‚Äúokay let‚Äôs try this one.‚Äù

My friends even took it to their own homes, and it is helping with their families as well!

It is great when others listen to you and accept your ideas even though you are young. We can all bring that harmony with our friends and family.

rows.media_title: Can you make an impact on your community with these skills? Hear @data.characters.media_son_2.name's story
rows.media_transcript:
When my father introduced the problem-solving steps to me, it helped me with my family, but it also helped me with my friends.

I told my friends about the steps, and now when we are arguing we sit down and everyone comes up with solutions. We then look for the negatives and positives of each solution, and we agree ‚Äúokay let‚Äôs try this one.‚Äù

My friends even took it to their own homes, and it is helping with their families as well!

It is great when others listen to you and accept your ideas even though you are young. We can all bring that harmony with our friends and family.
